text: is a Japanese athlete. He is best known as a judoka.SportsReference.com (SR/Olympics), "Hiroaki Hiraoka" ; retrieved 2012-7-29. ==History== He won a silver medal at the 2009 World Judo ChampionshipsJudoinside.com, "World Championships Rotterdam, 2009, Netherlands"; retrieved 2012-7-29. and bronze medal at the 2010 World Judo Championships.Judoinside.com, "World Championships Tokyo, 2010, Japan"; retrieved 2012-7-29. Hiroka won the silver medal in 2012 Summer Olympics at London, in the men's under 60 kg extra- lightweight judo."Arsen Galstyan beats Hiroaki Hiraoka to claim gold," BBC. July 28, 2012; retrieved 2012-7-29. ==References== ==Other websites== * Hiroaki Hiraoka at the Judoinside.com Category:1985 births Category:Living people Category:Olympic silver medalists for Japan Category:Japanese judoka
title: Hiroaki Hiraoka
